page.title: 10FARMING EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Recently there has been oilseed rape growing beside a favourite path. After the brilliant yellow faded, the seed pods turned the field a soft green. At harvest time there was a lot of rain and the farmer could not start to harvest it. He became very concerned as it began to blacken and the seeds shoot out of their pods. On the first possible day, the team worked by headlights till four o'clock in the morning to get the crop in. This was necessary as there are now so few men employed on the farm that there were not enough staff to make a second shift; one was needed to mind the drier and another to drive the crop over to the collecting centre.
